metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: XML Syntax Rules
The syntax rules of XML are very simple and logical. The rules are easy to learn, and easy to use.
content.html: The syntax rules of XML are very simple and logical. The rules are easy to learn, and easy to use.

content.text: XML Documents Must Have a Root Element
XML documents must contain one root element that is the parent of all other elements:
content.html: XML documents must contain one root element that is the parent of all other elements:

content.code_html:
<root>
  <child>
    <subchild>.....</subchild>
  </child>
</root>

content.text: In this example <note> is the root element:
content.html: In this example <note> is the root element:

content.code:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

<note>

<to>Tove</to>

<from>Jani</from>

<heading>Reminder</heading>

<body>Don't forget me this weekend!</body>

</note>
content.code_html:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<note>
  <to>Tove</to>
  <from>Jani</from>
  <heading>Reminder</heading>
  <body>Don't forget me this weekend!</body>
</note>

content.text: The XML Prolog
This line is called the XML prolog :
content.html: This line is called the XML prolog:

content.code_html: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

content.text: The XML prolog is optional. If it exists, it must come first in the document.
content.html: The XML prolog is optional. If it exists, it must come first in the document.

content.text: XML documents can contain international characters, like Norwegian øæå or French êèé.
content.html: XML documents can contain international characters, like Norwegian øæå or French êèé.

content.text: To avoid errors, you should specify the encoding used, or save your XML files as UTF-8.
content.html: To avoid errors, you should specify the encoding used, or save your XML files as UTF-8.

content.text: UTF-8 is the default character encoding for XML documents.
content.html: UTF-8 is the default character encoding for XML documents.

content.text: Character encoding can be studied in our Character Set Tutorial .
content.html: Character encoding can be studied in our Character Set Tutorial.

content.text: UTF-8 is also the default encoding for HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, and SQL.
content.html: UTF-8 is also the default encoding for HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, and SQL.

content.text: All XML Elements Must Have a Closing Tag
In XML, it is illegal to omit the closing tag. All elements must have a closing tag:
content.html: In XML, it is illegal to omit the closing tag. All elements must have a closing tag:

content.code_html:
<p>This is a paragraph.</p>
<br />

content.text: Note: The XML prolog does not have a closing tag! This is not an error. The prolog is not a part of the XML document.
content.html: Note: The XML prolog does not have a closing tag! This is not an error. The prolog is not a part of the XML document.

content.text: XML Tags are Case Sensitive
XML tags are case sensitive. The tag <Letter> is different from the tag <letter>.
content.html: XML tags are case sensitive. The tag <Letter> is different from the tag <letter>.

content.text: Opening and closing tags must be written with the same case:
content.html: Opening and closing tags must be written with the same case:

content.code_html: <message>This is correct</message>

content.text: "Opening and closing tags" are often referred to as "Start and end tags". Use whatever you prefer. It is exactly the same thing.
content.html: "Opening and closing tags" are often referred to as "Start and end tags". Use whatever you prefer. It is exactly the same thing.

content.text: XML Elements Must be Properly Nested
In HTML, you might see improperly nested elements:
content.html: In HTML, you might see improperly nested elements:

content.code_html: <b><i>This text is bold and italic</b></i>

content.text: In XML, all elements must be properly nested within each other:
content.html: In XML, all elements must be properly nested within each other:

content.code_html: <b><i>This text is bold and italic</i></b>

content.text: In the example above, "Properly nested" simply means that since the <i> element is opened inside the <b> element, it must be closed inside the <b> element.
content.html: In the example above, "Properly nested" simply means that since the <i> element is opened inside the <b> element, it must be closed inside the <b> element.

content.text: XML Attribute Values Must Always be Quoted
XML elements can have attributes in name/value pairs just like in HTML.
content.html: XML elements can have attributes in name/value pairs just like in HTML.

content.text: In XML, the attribute values must always be quoted:
content.html: In XML, the attribute values must always be quoted:

content.code_html:
<note date="12/11/2007">
  <to>Tove</to>
  <from>Jani</from>
</note>

content.text: Entity References
Some characters have a special meaning in XML.
content.html: Some characters have a special meaning in XML.

content.text: If you place a character like "<" inside an XML element, it will generate an error because the parser interprets it as the start of a new element.
content.html: If you place a character like "<" inside an XML element, it will generate an error because the parser interprets it as the start of a new element.

content.text: This will generate an XML error:
content.html: This will generate an XML error:

content.text: To avoid this error, replace the "<" character with an entity reference :
content.html: To avoid this error, replace the "<" character with an entity reference:

content.code_html: <message>salary < 1000</message>

content.text: There are 5 pre-defined entity references in XML:
content.html: There are 5 pre-defined entity references in XML:

content.code_html:
< < less than
> > greater than
& & ampersand 
' ' apostrophe
" " quotation mark

content.text: Only < and & are strictly illegal in XML, but it is a good habit to replace > with > as well.
content.html: Only < and & are strictly illegal in XML, but it is a good habit to replace > with > as well.

content.text: Comments in XML
The syntax for writing comments in XML is similar to that of HTML:
content.html: The syntax for writing comments in XML is similar to that of HTML:

content.code_html: <!-- This is a comment -->

content.text: Two dashes in the middle of a comment are not allowed:
content.html: Two dashes in the middle of a comment are not allowed:

content.code_html: <!-- This is an invalid -- comment -->

content.text: White-space is Preserved in XML
XML does not truncate multiple white-spaces (HTML truncates multiple white-spaces to one single white-space):
content.html: XML does not truncate multiple white-spaces (HTML truncates multiple white-spaces to one single white-space):

content.code_html:
XML: Hello           Tove
HTML: Hello Tove

content.text: XML Stores New Line as LF
Windows applications store a new line as: carriage return and line feed (CR+LF).
content.html: Windows applications store a new line as: carriage return and line feed (CR+LF).

content.text: Unix and Mac OSX use LF.
content.html: Unix and Mac OSX use LF.

content.text: Old Mac systems use CR.
content.html: Old Mac systems use CR.

content.text: XML stores a new line as LF.
content.html: XML stores a new line as LF.

content.text: Well Formed XML
XML documents that conform to the syntax rules above are said to be "Well Formed" XML documents.
content.html: XML documents that conform to the syntax rules above are said to be "Well Formed" XML documents.
